member.name: T:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsService
member.summary: The Contacts Data API allows client applications to view and update a user's contacts. Contacts are stored in the user's Google Account; most Google services have access to the contact list. Your client application can use the Contacts Data API to create new contacts, edit or delete existing contacts, and query for contacts that match particular criteria.

member.name: T:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsFeed
member.summary:
A contact feed is a private read/write feed that can be used to view and manage a user's contacts. The URI for the feed is as follows: http://www.google.com/m8/feeds/contacts/userID/base
For example, the contacts feed for user liz@gmail.com would have the following URI: http://www.google.com/m8/feeds/contacts/liz%40gmail.com/base
Since the contact feed is private, you can access it only by using an authenticated request. That is, the request must contain an authentication token for the user whose contacts you want to retrieve.

member.name: M:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsFeed.#ctor(System.Uri,Google.GData.Client.IService)
member.summary: default constructor
member.param: the base URI of the feedEntry
the Service to use

member.name: M:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsFeed.#ctor(System.String,Google.GData.Client.IService)
member.summary: default constructor with user name
member.param: the username for the contacts feed
the Service to use

member.name: M:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsFeed.CreateFeedEntry
member.summary: this needs to get implemented by subclasses

member.name: M:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsFeed.HandleExtensionElements(Google.GData.Client.ExtensionElementEventArgs,Google.GData.Client.AtomFeedParser)
member.summary: gets called after we already handled the custom entry, to handle all other potential parsing tasks
member.param: the atom feed parser used

member.name: T:Google.GData.Contacts.GroupsFeed
member.summary:
A groups feed is a private read/write feed that can be used to view and manage a user's groups. The URI for the feed is as follows: http://www.google.com/m8/feeds/groups/userID/base
For example, the contacts feed for user liz@gmail.com would have the following URI: http://www.google.com/m8/feeds/groups/liz%40gmail.com/base
Since the groups feed is private, you can access it only by using an authenticated request. That is, the request must contain an authentication token for the user whose contacts you want to retrieve.

member.name: M:Google.GData.Contacts.GroupsFeed.#ctor(System.Uri,Google.GData.Client.IService)
member.summary: default constructor
member.param: the base URI of the feedEntry
the Service to use

member.name: M:Google.GData.Contacts.GroupsFeed.#ctor(System.String,Google.GData.Client.IService)
member.summary: default constructor with user name
member.param: the username for the contacts feed
the Service to use

member.summary: this needs to get implemented by subclasses

member.summary: gets called after we already handled the custom entry, to handle all other potential parsing tasks
member.param: the atom feed parser used

member.summary: An event associated with a contact. May be repeated.

member.summary: Describes an ID of the contact in an external system of some kind. This element may be repeated.

member.summary: Specifies the gender of the person represented by the contact. The element cannot be repeated.

member.name: F:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsNameTable.HobbyElement
member.summary: Specifies hobbies or interests of the person specified by the contact. The element can be repeated

member.summary: Specifies the initials of the person represented by the contact. The element cannot be repeated.

member.name: F:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsNameTable.JotElement
member.summary: Storage for arbitrary pieces of information about the contact. Each jot has a type specified by the rel attribute and a text value. The element can be repeated.

member.name: F:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsNameTable.LanguageElement
member.summary: Specifies the preferred languages of the contact. The element can be repeated

member.name: F:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsNameTable.MaidenNameElement
member.summary: Specifies maiden name of the person represented by the contact. The element cannot be repeated.

member.summary: Specifies the mileage for the entity represented by the contact. Can be used for example to document distance needed for reimbursement purposes. The value is not interpreted. The element cannot be repeated

member.summary: Specifies the occupation/profession of the person specified by the contact. The element cannot be repeated.

member.summary: Classifies importance into 3 categories. can not be repeated

member.name: T:Google.GData.Contacts.GroupsQuery
member.summary:
A subclass of FeedQuery, to create an Contacts query URI. Provides public properties that describe the different aspects of the URI, as well as a composite URI. The ContactsQuery supports the following GData parameters: The Contacts Data API supports the following standard Google Data API query parameters: Name Description alt The type of feed to return, such as atom (the default), rss, or json. max-results The maximum number of entries to return. If you want to receive all of the contacts, rather than only the default maximum, you can specify a very large number for max-results. start-index The 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved (for paging). updated-min The lower bound on entry update dates.
For more information about the standard parameters, see the Google Data APIs protocol reference document. In addition to the standard query parameters, the Contacts Data API supports the following parameters:
Name Description orderby Sorting criterion. The only supported value is lastmodified. showdeleted Include deleted contacts in the returned contacts feed. Deleted contacts are shown as entries that contain nothing but an atom:id element and a gd:deleted element. (Google retains placeholders for deleted contacts for 30 days after deletion; during that time, you can request the placeholders using the showdeleted query parameter.) Valid values are true or false. sortorder Sorting order direction. Can be either ascending or descending. group Constrains the results to only the contacts belonging to the group specified. Value of this parameter specifies group ID (see also: gContact:groupMembershipInfo).

member.name: P:Google.GData.Contacts.GroupsQuery.ShowDeleted
member.summary: Include deleted contacts in the returned contacts feed. Deleted contacts are shown as entries that contain nothing but an atom:id element and a gd:deleted element. (Google retains placeholders for deleted contacts for 30 days after deletion; during that time, you can request the placeholders using the showdeleted query parameter.) Valid values are true or false.

member.name: T:Google.GData.Contacts.ContactsQuery
member.summary:
A subclass of GroupsQuery, to create an Contacts query URI. Provides public properties that describe the different aspects of the URI, as well as a composite URI. The ContactsQuery supports the following GData parameters: Name Description alt The type of feed to return, such as atom (the default), rss, or json. max-results The maximum number of entries to return. If you want to receive all of the contacts, rather than only the default maximum, you can specify a very large number for max-results. start-index The 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved (for paging). updated-min The lower bound on entry update dates.
For more information about the standard parameters, see the Google Data APIs protocol reference document. In addition to the standard query parameters, the Contacts Data API supports the following parameters:
Name Description orderby Sorting criterion. The only supported value is lastmodified. showdeleted Include deleted contacts in the returned contacts feed. Deleted contacts are shown as entries that contain nothing but an atom:id element and a gd:deleted element. (Google retains placeholders for deleted contacts for 30 days after deletion; during that time, you can request the placeholders using the showdeleted query parameter.) Valid values are true or false. sortorder Sorting order direction. Can be either ascending or descending. group Constrains the results to only the contacts belonging to the group specified. Value of this parameter specifies group ID (see also: gContact:groupMembershipInfo).

member.name: P:Google.Contacts.Group.SystemGroup

member.name: T:Google.Contacts.ContactsRequest
member.summary: The Contacts Data API provides two types of feed: contacts feed and contact groups feed. The feeds are private read/write feeds that can be used to view and manage a user's contacts/groups. Since they are private, a programmer can access them only by using an authenticated request. That is, the request must contain an authentication token for the user whose contacts you want to retrieve.
